articles.content:
Reception given to mark PRC birthday 
    Chongjin, October 2 (KCNA) -- The North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Korea-China Friendship Association gave a reception on Tuesday evening on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the People's Republic of China.
 Present on invitation were consul general Liu Zhigang and members of the Chinese consulate general in Chongjin.    
 Present were Kim Song Gwon, vice-chairman of the North Hamgyong Provincial People's Committee who is the chairman of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Korea-China Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.
 Speeches were made there.

articles.content:
Greetings to Guinean President 
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Lansana Conte, President of Guinea, on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president and people of guinea greater success in their work for national unity and socio-economic development.

articles.content:
Greetings to German President 
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to German President Johannes Rau on Tuesday on the occasion of Germany's National Day.
 He in the message expressed pleasure at the bilateral relations positively developing in different fields after the establishment of diplomatic relations.    
 Expressing confidence that the relations between the two countries would continue to deepen and develop in their mutual interests in the future, too, he wished the president bigger success in his work for the prosperity of Germany and the wellbeing of its people.

articles.content:
South Korean delegation here
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the South Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice headed by father Kim Pyong Sang arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by Jang Jae On, chairman of the central committee of the Korean Catholics Association, and officials concerned.
